title: Publish Version 30 by setting app publication status to published

requirements.text: Publish the currently deployed Version 30 build by setting the backend publication status to "published" using the existing admin-only publish mechanism (backend method: publishApp), so regular users can access the Landing Page / Profile Setup / Dashboard instead of the takedown screen.
acceptanceCriteria: When an admin triggers the existing publish action, the backend publication status becomes "published" (PublicationStatus.#published).
Visiting '/' as an unauthenticated user shows the Landing Page (not the Takedown screen).
Visiting '/' as an authenticated user reaches Profile Setup (if no profile exists) or Dashboard (if a profile exists), without being blocked by unpublished/maintenance gating.
Non-admin users cannot publish (attempts are rejected with an English authorization error and the UI does not expose admin publication controls to non-admins).

constraints: Respect the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture; do not introduce additional canisters/services.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose existing UI components instead.
nonGoals: Do not change any other app behavior or features beyond publishing (no additional UI/UX changes, pricing changes, or role-gating changes).
Do not add new authentication providers; continue using Internet Identity only.
